Another interesting option could be "Dear John" (2010), a movie that follows a girl who hides out with transvestites, offering a unique perspective on societal norms and expectations. Both "12 Monkeys" and "Minority Report" are excellent choices, as they delve deep into a post-apocalyptic world while offering intricate plots and star-studded casts featuring actors like Bruce Willis, Brad Pitt, Tom Cruise, and more.

"12 Monkeys," with its time-travel elements and thrilling mystery, might be an especially interesting watch given your preference for thinking outside the box. However, if you're drawn to a more melancholic exploration of loss and memories, "Haunted" could offer a unique perspective on the theme of dystopia as well.

This action-packed film features John Carpenter as the director and Kurt Russell in the lead role, where a prison-turned-city is the setting for an intense mission.

Additionally, if you're open to exploring other genres within dystopia, "Patriot Games" (1987) might also appeal to you. This political thriller stars Harrison Ford as CIA analyst Jack Ryan, and follows his life being threatened by a renegade faction after he interferes with an IRA assassination. Enjoy the suspense!
